title: Exec ‘punched wife’ in air rampage
text:
Police say a British Airways flight traveling from London to Houston made an emergency landing in Boston after a passenger allegedly assaulted his wife. Linda So reports. Reuters 09 Jul 2015 News 
HE’S a company director at Minimiser Limited, but there was no downplaying the trouble businessman Darren Halliwell was in as he stood ashen faced in a courtroom overnight. 
The musclebound 48-year-old IT professional from Manchester in the UK is facing up to 20 years in and American prison after an alleged drunken rampage aboard a British Airways flight that included punching his wife Sharon and urinating in the cabin. 
The gym enthusiast and his wife were travelling to a weightlifting event in Houston, Texas, on Wednesday when he allegedly forced the plane to divert and make an emergency stop in Boston so he could be hauled off. 
Trouble began after the couple boarded the 747 at Heathrow, bound for the USAPL Summer Powerfest, and Mr Halliwell started drinking, The Mirror reports, 
Passengers claimed he became abusive, yelling and pushing at least three flight crew. 
He allegedly punched Sharon, 46, in the face before falling on top of other passengers, Boston’s WCVB reports . He is also accused of pulling down his shorts to relieve himself in his seat as other passengers, including children, looked on. 
“I was in the bathroom and when I came out he was standing there talking to three of the airline guys,” one witness said. “He was a really big guy. He had taken his shirt off.” 
He was allegedly so drunk he couldn’t walk on his own, Fox 8 reports , and flight attendants were unable to restrain him. Darren Halliwell faces East Boston District Court. Source: Supplied 
As the trans-Atlantic flight approached the US coast, flight crew were forced to inform the captain, who contacted air traffic control to divert the plane to Boston, The Mirror reports. 
Massachusetts state police said troopers met the plane and arrested Mr Halliwell, a father-of-two, on charges of interfering with flight crew. 
Dressed in a Foo Fighters T-shirt and flanked by court officers, he appeared before the East Boston District Court overnight as the case against him was read out. 
“Another passenger interviewed said that he saw the defendant very intoxicating and the defendant fell on him twice as he got out of his seat and tried to walk down the aisle,” a prosecutor told Judge John McDonald. 
“He stated that he saw the defendant strike his wife with the back of his fist. He also stated that he saw the defendant yelling at other passengers and would not listen to the flight attendants. 
“While he pulled his shorts and underwear down to urinate in his seat there were many passengers in proximity to him, including a 14-year-old girl.” 
Mr Halliwell was also charged with disorderly conduct and assault and battery. 
His lawyer, Aditi Goel, said Mr Halliwell regularly travelled to the US, and had visited at least 25 times. 
The Mirror reports after her husband’s alleged attack, Sharon Halliwell continued on to Houston but intended to return to the couple’s $1.3 million country home in Aspull, near Wigan. 
“[He has] acted up in the past but this was by far the worst,” she told authorities. 
The paper quoted an acquaintance of Mr Halliwell as saying he was “big into his sport.” 
“I’m absolutely stunned that he had been arrested. 
“I know him pretty well and he is a really nice guy and normally very mild-mannered. 
“They’ve lived in the village for years and been married quite a while, with two grown-up daughters.” 
Meanwhile, British Airways has defended the pilot’s actions. 
“Our customers and crews deserve to enjoy their flights, and not to suffer any form of abuse,” the company said in a statement. 
“The Captain took the decision to divert the aircraft to Boston as a precaution. 
“The matter will now be handled by the police.” 
Mr Halliwell’s bail was set at $6700. He is due to face court again on July 29.
